resources.string: Check whether your device is vulnerable to the Rowhammer bug:
We would like to use your IMEI (protected by Android with the permission to \"make and manage phone calls\") to estimate the age of your device.

Drammer is a deterministic Rowhammer-based attack that relies on the predictable memory reuse patterns by physical memory allocators. This app allows you to test whether your device is vulnerable to Rowhammer.
You can specify how aggressively the app tries to free up memory to test, however, use this option with caution: setting it too high likely causes the app to become unresponsive and may hang your device and trigger a reboot. 

The app optionally also collects basic statistics on the type of your device and your test results so that we can gain insights into the number and type of vulnerable devices in the wild, so please consider sharing them for science. 

DISCLAIMER
Use this app at your own risk. We are not responsible for any device damage, undesired side effects, or unexpected behavior. A negative test result also does not guarantee that your device is not vulnerable to Rowhammer. 

MORE INFO
Drammer: Deterministic Rowhammer Attacks on Mobile Platforms
ACM Conference on Computer and Communications Security (CCS 2016)
https://www.vusec.net/projects/drammer
GuardION: Practical Mitigation of DMA-based Rowhammer Attacks on ARM
Conference on Detection of Intrusions and Malware & Vulnerability Assessment (DIMVA 2018)
https://rampageattack.com 

INCLUDED LIBRARIES
https://github.com/jaredrummler/AndroidDeviceNames"

Bit flips found. Your device is vulnerable to Rowhammer.
Drammer is currently not available for your device.
Do you want to send feedback to our server?
